claim: High-intensity statins reduce major cardiovascular events in secondary prevention.
Smoking increases the risk of lung cancer.
Hypertension increases the risk of stroke.
HPV vaccination reduces the risk of cervical cancer.
Type 2 diabetes increases the risk of chronic kidney disease.
Regular physical activity reduces the risk of type 2 diabetes.
Obesity is associated with higher risk of coronary heart disease.
Chronic hepatitis B infection increases the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma.
Long-term sun exposure increases the risk of non-melanoma skin cancer.
Influenza vaccination reduces the risk of severe influenza in older adults.
SGLT2 inhibitors reduce hospitalization for heart failure in reduced ejection fraction.
PCSK9 inhibitors lower LDL cholesterol beyond statins alone.
CPAP improves daytime sleepiness in obstructive sleep apnea.
Direct-acting antivirals can cure chronic hepatitis C in most patients.
Bariatric surgery improves glycemic control in severe obesity with type 2 diabetes.
Antibiotic misuse contributes to antimicrobial resistance.
Poor oral hygiene increases the risk of gingivitis and periodontitis.
High dietary sodium increases blood pressure.
Secondhand smoke exposure increases respiratory illness risk in children.
Uncontrolled diabetes increases the risk of diabetic retinopathy.
Untreated obstructive sleep apnea increases cardiovascular risk.
Chronic kidney disease can cause anemia.
Excessive alcohol intake increases the risk of liver cirrhosis.
Vitamin B12 deficiency can cause neurological symptoms.
Low vitamin D levels are associated with reduced bone mineral density.
A high-fiber diet improves bowel regularity.
Colorectal cancer screening improves detection of early-stage disease.
HPV infection is a necessary cause of most cervical cancers.
HIV infection can be controlled with antiretroviral therapy.
Long-term corticosteroid use increases osteoporosis risk.
Elevated LDL cholesterol increases atherosclerotic cardiovascular risk.
Physical inactivity increases risk of osteoporosis.
Air pollution exposure can worsen asthma symptoms.
Processed meat intake is associated with higher colorectal cancer risk.
Vaccination reduces the risk of measles outbreaks.
Obesity increases the risk of knee osteoarthritis.
High triglycerides increase cardiovascular risk.
Chronic stress is associated with higher anxiety risk.

Smoking during pregnancy increases risk of low birth weight.
Breastfeeding provides immune protection to infants.
Excessive UV tanning increases melanoma risk.
High-sugar intake contributes to dental caries.
Vaccination reduces the risk of severe COVID-19.
Dietary trans fats increase cardiovascular risk.
Iron deficiency causes anemia.
Iodine deficiency can lead to goiter.
Poor sleep is associated with higher depression risk.
High blood glucose damages small blood vessels over time.
Regular handwashing reduces transmission of respiratory infections.
Regular aerobic exercise lowers resting blood pressure in many adults.
Smoking cessation reduces cardiovascular risk over time.
Obstructive sleep apnea is associated with hypertension.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease is linked to long-term tobacco exposure.
Type 1 diabetes requires lifelong insulin therapy.
Insulin resistance is a core feature of metabolic syndrome.
Uncontrolled hyperthyroidism can cause weight loss and tachycardia.
Hypothyroidism can cause fatigue and cold intolerance.
Long-term benzodiazepine use is associated with dependence risk.
Vaccination against hepatitis B reduces the incidence of chronic infection.
SARS-CoV-2 vaccination reduces hospitalization risk for COVID-19.
Smoking increases the risk of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
High alcohol intake increases risk of pancreatitis.
Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease is associated with obesity and insulin resistance.
Untreated atrial fibrillation increases the risk of ischemic stroke.
Anticoagulation reduces stroke risk in atrial fibrillation for eligible patients.
Antibiotic therapy is effective for confirmed bacterial pneumonia.
Most acute viral upper respiratory infections do not require antibiotics.
H. pylori infection is a risk factor for peptic ulcer disease.
Eradication of H. pylori reduces ulcer recurrence.
Chronic hepatitis C can progress to cirrhosis if untreated.
Statins reduce LDL cholesterol levels.
Familial hypercholesterolemia increases early cardiovascular risk.
Diabetic neuropathy is more common with poor glycemic control.
Diabetic nephropathy can cause proteinuria.
Hypertension can damage the kidneys over time.
Chronic kidney disease increases cardiovascular risk.
Influenza can cause severe disease in older adults and infants.
Measles infection can cause serious complications such as pneumonia.
Varicella vaccination reduces the incidence of chickenpox.
Cervical cancer screening can detect precancerous lesions.
Colon polyps can be precursors to colorectal cancer.
Helicobacter pylori is classified as a carcinogen for gastric cancer.
High-risk HPV types are associated with cervical cancer.
Smoking increases the risk of bladder cancer.
Excess UV exposure increases risk of cataracts.
Uncontrolled hypertension increases risk of intracerebral hemorrhage.
Chronic NSAID use increases risk of gastrointestinal bleeding.
Proton pump inhibitors reduce gastric acid secretion.
Untreated depression is associated with increased suicide risk.
Cognitive behavioral therapy is effective for many anxiety disorders.
Obesity is associated with increased risk of obstructive sleep apnea.
Regular resistance training improves muscle strength.
Osteoporosis increases fracture risk in older adults.
Calcium and vitamin D support bone health.
Smoking is associated with increased risk of osteoporosis.
Chronic inflammation is associated with atherosclerosis.
Elevated HbA1c reflects poorer glycemic control.
Insulin therapy can reduce hyperglycemia in diabetes.
Early ambulation reduces risk of postoperative venous thromboembolism.
Low birth weight is associated with higher infant morbidity.
Premature birth increases risk of respiratory distress syndrome.
Exclusive breastfeeding is recommended for the first months of life.
Iron deficiency in pregnancy increases risk of maternal anemia.
Folic acid supplementation reduces neural tube defect risk.
Blood transfusion can be lifesaving in severe anemia.
Trans fats increase LDL and reduce HDL cholesterol.
High saturated fat intake is associated with increased LDL cholesterol.
Dietary fiber can improve glycemic control in some patients with diabetes.
Celiac disease is an autoimmune reaction to gluten.
Lactose intolerance can cause bloating and diarrhea after dairy intake.
Inflammatory bowel disease increases colorectal cancer risk.
Crohn’s disease can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
Ulcerative colitis primarily affects the colon.

Barrett’s esophagus increases risk of esophageal adenocarcinoma.
High blood pressure is a modifiable risk factor for stroke.
Diabetic retinopathy can cause vision loss if untreated.
Uncontrolled asthma increases risk of exacerbations.
Inhaled corticosteroids reduce asthma exacerbation frequency.
Beta-lactam antibiotics are effective against many gram-positive infections.
MRSA is resistant to many beta-lactam antibiotics.

Latent tuberculosis infection can progress to active disease.

High-risk pregnancies benefit from prenatal care.
